ETYMOLOGY: From Old French village, from Latin villaticum ('of a country house'), from villa ('country house, farm').

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A group of houses and associated buildings, larger than a hamlet and smaller than a town, situated in a rural area.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 乡村，村庄：比村落大，比城镇小的农村聚居地。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She grew up in a small, picturesque village nestled in the valley.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她在山谷中一个风景如画的小村庄长大。
